page.title: 01BURGHFIELD GAZETTEER
page.content: {Once primarily farmland, gravel {extraction and light industry now play {a part in changing the landscape. {Farming still dominates. Privately {owned farms exist along side several {managed by tennant farmers who lease {land from the Benyon family's {Englefield estate. Cereal crops and {dairying predominate. Gravel beds are {plentiful. Its extraction is a major {activity. Newbury District Council {stipulate exhausted quarries must {revert to farmland although many have {been flooded to provide inland water {areas for recreation and conservation {of wildlife. A recent feature is the {industrial estate funded by the {Norwich Union Insurance Co. Units are {leased to firms for manufacturing and {warehousing. Wooded areas still exist {and there is a feeling of resistance {to furthur development.
